entry.title: Episode 2. Concurrency – CSP & Actors
entry.summary: Episode #2. Concurrency – CSP & Actors. Guests: Aaron Schlesinger http://arschles.com/ and Jörgen Brandt http://www.joergen-brandt.de/
entry.content:
Concurrency – CSP & Actors

Multithreading is not the only approach we use to deal with concurrency. Single-purpose processes is our next frontier. Processes, that don`t have shared state. To coordinate, they pass messages to each other.

We can build complex concurrent systems using simple principles of CSP or Actors model. We break down programs into independent processes, each performing some specific job, talking to each other. How they talk to each is the point of contention here. That`s where the differences between CSP and Actors arise.

Host: Andrey Salomatin twitter.com/filipovskii

Guests

  • Aaron Schlesinger arschles.com/
  • Jörgen Brandt http://www.joergen-brandt.de/

entry.title: Episode 1. Concurrency
entry.summary: First episode. Concurrency and multithreading. Speakers: Daniel Higginbotham, Steve Klabnik.
entry.content:
Laws of Newtonian mechanics don`t make sense as we get closer to the speed of light. Laws of serial execution are useless once we enter the world of concurrency.

In this episode well define concurrency and talk about why is it hard to write concurrent programs. With the help of Daniel and Steve well explore tools that are there in Clojure and Rust to help engineers deal with multiple threads of execution.
